items.content:
AWS DevOps Engineer - Fully Remote - 600-800 per day - 6 months+

Jefferson Frank are working with one of the most reputable up and coming Cloud Technology Partners. They are looking for an accomplished DevOps Engineer / Consultant to help advise customers on how to implement DevOps best practices within AWS. The ideal candidate will have vast experience working with multiple AWS services and serverless functions. You will also have experience building secure, scalable infrastructure-as-code and will have carried out various cost optimisation and governance tasks.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work a fully remote role for a great consultancy full of likeminded individuals. This is a hands-on role, however the client are looking for someone to come in and provide a consultative approach to help advise clients and key stakeholders on how to leverage the full benefits of AWS within multiple migration and transformation projects. Although this position is fully remote, the successful candidate is required to travel for team meetings at different client locations and take critical calls when required.

Essential experience:

- Proven experience working on multiple AWS services (AWS, EC2, S3, Route53, VPN, VPC)

- Exposure to AWS build and migration

- Building Infrastructure-as-code: CloudFormation, Terraform

- Configuration management: Ansible, Puppet, Chef

- High competency of scripting: Python, Bash, Shell

- Hands-on experience implementing DevOps best practices within AWS

Desirable:

- Building AWS stacks from scratch

- Experience working Digital Transformation projects

- Experience working migration projects

- Cost optimisation & governance

- Consulting experience within AWS & DevOps

- AWS Certification - Associate level

Does this sound like you? If so click below and apply! Best of luck with your applications.

Phone:

Email:

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
DevOps Engineer, Azure, Remote Working


Are you a DevOps Engineer looking to make a real impact? Are you interested in working on a remote basis? We're working alongside a company who have recently had huge funding into their tech stack and are now looking for a DevOps Engineer like you to implement a true DevOps and CI/CD culture into their development team. This is a challenging project, but an exciting one!

The Role


As the DevOps Engineer you will be helping the company on their journey from on-premise development to Azure cloud, working with tech like Terraform, Azure DevOps and AKS. You will work to configuring build and release pipelines, achieving a CI/CD environment with multiple deployments a day, so experience working in a similar velocity environment would be great.

As the DevOps Engineer you'll have a focus on automating as many tasks as possible, whilst being confident scripting (ideally with Powershell). You'll get the chance to work with Docker and Kubernetes for containerisation. As this is a Senior DevOps Engineer position, you'll also be responsible for mentoring junior team members, as well as reviewing and recommending DevOps tools moving forwards.

This DevOps Engineer position is offered on a flexible basis, with the option of as much remote working as you'd like. As long as you're able to come into the Oxfordshire office once a month, you can work from home as much or as little as you like!

The Company


With a global client-base and multiple UK sites, the DevOps Engineer will be joining an established organisation with a history of success behind them and a bright and exciting future! The company have had huge investment and are undertaking revolutionary changes to their range of products, so this is a great time for a DevOps Engineer to join.

What Next?

This is an incredible opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to have responsibility for implementing a DevOps environment from scratch, with a lot of autonomy and a chance to really make an impact on a great tech company.

If you're a Senior DevOps Engineer looking for your next challenge, the please apply or give me a call today so I can give you more details on this great role.

DevOps Engineer, Azure, Remote Working


Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
AWS, Lambda, OWASP tools for penetration testing, Terraform, Ansible, Cloud Formation, Java, Scala, NIST Security guidelines

Job Title: Senior 'DevSecOps' Engineer
Job Location: Menlo Park, CA or REMOTE
Salary Range: 150k-200k DOE + Equity
Required Skills: AWS, Lambda, Terraform, penetration testing, security
Nice To Have Skills: Blockchain/Cryptocurrency experience, Spark/Ignite

Based in Menlo Park, CA - We are a well-funded, revolutionary Blockahin/Cryptocurrency security startup paving the way for cryptocurrency, crypto asset & blockchain intelligence, analytics & compliance. We provide blockchain analytics & intelligence for financial investigations, anti-money laundering, counter-terrorist financing, verification of funds, audit and compliance. We received our 2nd round of funding last month ($15M ) and need to scale our engineering team!

What You Will Be Doing

- Enabling engineering team to deply product features
- Develop & maintain CI/CD features
- Build highly scalable disributed systems on AWS
- Penetration Testing

What You Need for this Position

- BS or MS Degree in Computer Science highly preferred (not required)
- 3+ years of experience deploying highly scalable distributed systems on AWS
- Ability to write a Lambda function
- Programming experience with one of the following: Scala, Java, C/C++, Go
- DNS & Networking
- NIST security guidelines

BONUS experience:
- Passion for blockchain/cryptocurrency
- Apache Spark/Ignite

What's In It for You

- 100% REMOTE
- GREAT starting salary + benefits + 401k + PTO + EquitySo, if you are a Senior DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

Location: Lincolnshire, IL

Selling Point:

This project does not start until (July end) will last for 6 months to 1 year. Must be Juniper JNCIE-DC certified. This is a support and troubleshooting role not an architect role. NSX is a plus would prefer local to drive in to meeting 2 times a month but open to remote with 10% travel.

items.content:
DevOps Engineer, PSaaS

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: DevOps
Industry: Information Technology, IT Security, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201500 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Auth0 | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time - Regina +/- 2 hours

Technologies

saas
automation
devops
aws
git
Culture
vision and principles
our culture
Nathan Totten Director of Customer Success at Auth0 8.9k 1 29 38
twistedstream 110 1 7
KukicAdo 3 2
eduardods 56 3

Job description

Auth0s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. Thats what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer.We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles.Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!We are growing the Auth0 Private SaaS engineering team and are looking for a DevOps Engineer to help us design and build an amazing product. You would be a great fit for the team if you enjoy working on challenging problems and care deeply about the products end user experience. Not only are we looking for a talented engineer we are looking for someone who will contribute to our culture.Many of our largest customers rely on Private SaaS to deliver a dedicated, isolated environment to build identity solutions in their products. This team is responsible for building the tools, processes and services required to deploy and maintain the Auth0 platform capable of running in a customer or an Auth0 managed infrastructure.The team responsibilities:The team has two main responsibilities. First, to deliver world-class services and tools that make it simple and enjoyable to manage and maintain Auth0's Private SaaS environments. Second, to ensure that all the features available to our customers in the cloud offerings are also available to our Private SaaS customers. We care deeply about the experience our customers have when managing and maintaining our product as well as ensuring the quality of the Auth0 service is delivered.

As part of the DevOps engineering team you will be:

    • Designing and implementing automation for packaging and deploying our product in a private SaaS environment.
    • Driving and participating in design discussions.
    • Improving configuration management.
    • Performing code reviews.
    • Designing, building and maintaining internal services to support our regular operation.
    • Working with teams throughout Auth0 so their products work on the Private SaaS.

Youd be a good fit if you:

    • Designing and implementing automation for packaging and deploying the appliance.
    • Driving and participating in design discussions.
    • Improving the configuration management of the appliance.
    • Helping review other team members code.
    • Working with teams throughout Auth0 so their products work on Appliance.

Youd be a good fit if you:

    • Have solid Linux/Unix administration skills.
    • Are passionate about building systems that are highly reliable, maintainable and scalable.
    • Enjoy automating processes.
    • Have experience with distributed systems, their complexities and challenges.
    • Have strong experience working with configuration management tools (eg. Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc).
    • Have a thorough understanding of security principals and concerns.
    • Are customer focused.
    • Enjoy working in a highly collaborative, dynamic and remote team.
    • Have experience in networking and routing concepts

Also useful if you:

    • Are familiar with Amazon Web Services
    • Are familiar with Git, WebHooks, Jenkins, and the Continuous Integration universe.
    • Are familiar with Node.js, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Redis, and PostgreSQL.
    • Are familiar with Docker and containers.
Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.
Apply now

About Auth0

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are transparent about how we run our recruiting process - you can read all about it here. You can also read about our company culture here.

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Competitive Equity
  • Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
  • Embrace Distributed Work
  • Inclusive Work Environment
  • Annual all-expenses paid international company offsite

items.content:
Snowplow Analytics

Site Reliability Engineer


Site Reliability Engineer (AWS)

Remote, ideally located in the UTC -4 to -6 region 

Snowplow enables you to track any event data; ask any question of that data and use any tool you want to answer it. We want to empower people and companies to do transformative things using data.  As a company, we have almost doubled in size over the last 18 months and were not looking to slow down.

To support our growth, we are now looking for an SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) to join our Tech Ops Team. Youll be taking the lead on all things AWS including development and improvements of the current stack and rolling out new features - all whilst keeping these environments running smoothly. We would love to hear from you if the idea of programmatically controlling thousands of production environments excites you!

The Opportunity: 

Our Private SaaS offering has grown significantly over the past year and we now orchestrate and monitor Snowplow event pipelines across more than 150 customer-owned AWS & GCP sub-accounts.  Each account has its own individualised and optimised stack and all are capable of processing many billions of events per month.

We are looking for another SRE to help us grow to managing 1,000 and then 10,000 AWS, GCP & Azure accounts. You will be pioneering solutions to managing estates of this size through cutting edge monitoring and automation. Youll work closely with our Tech Ops Lead on all aspects of our proprietary deployment, orchestration and monitoring stacks.

Tech Ops has two areas of responsibility: the centralised services we provide customers and their pipeline infrastructure hosted in their own AWS or GCP accounts.  Within both domains we are striving to increase service reliability, fulfil customer requests in a timely fashion, and automate recurring tasks.  Task automation is essential as our customer base grows, because our infrastructure estate scales linearly with our customer numbers, unlike most software businesses.

The challenge of automating the maintenance and deployment of thousands of individualised stacks is an enormously ambitious undertaking and a hugely exciting infrastructure automation challenge!

The environment youll be working in:

Our company values are Transparency, Honesty, Ownership, Inclusivity, Empowerment, Customer-centricity, Growth and Technical Excellence. These arent just words we plucked out of thin air, we came up with them together as a company and are continually looking to find new ways to weave these into our day to day operations. From flexible hours and working locations to the way we give feedback, were passionate about building a company that supports both company and individual development.

What youll be doing:


* Maintaining and developing our growing Terraform infrastructure-as-code stacks which we use to deploy infrastructure for all internal and client use cases

* Maintaining our internal infrastructure stacks which include the HashiCorp suite as well as our Snowplow Insights UI and VPNs

* Participating in our on-call rotation to help us serve our client base 24/7

* Taking rotations of L3 Technical Support where you will be responsible for triaging and dealing with infrastructure issues

* Handling high-severity internal or customer incidents, ensuring we meet all SLAs




What you bring to the team:


* Has worked with AWS in a production capacity - experience in GCP and/or Azure is a bonus

* Has worked with Terraform, CloudFormation or some form of infrastructure-as-code tooling

* Any experience with the HashiCorp stack (Vault, Consul, Nomad) and understanding their role in infrastructure automation is a bonus

* Has worked with Docker and is familiar with container-based architectures

* Knowledgeable about the Linux operating system and how to manage servers in a production capacity

* Knowledgeable about Cloud networking principles and how to troubleshoot issues in this space

* Comfortable scripting in one or more of: Bash, Python, Ruby or Perl

* Comfortable programming in one or more of: Java, Scala, Golang or Python




What youll get in return:


* A competitive package based on experience, including share options 25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)

* MacBook or Dell XPS 13/15

* Two fantastic company Away Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in May 2019 in Lisbon)

* Work alongside a supportive and talented team with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and challenging problems

* Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation

* Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee

* If based in London, convenient office location in central London (Shoreditch) and a continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks

Apply now

About Snowplow Analytics

We have an office located in London but believe in letting our team members choose where they work best so nearly half of the company currently works remotely. We offer flexibility, trust and freedom.

We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our fully remote TechOps team.

Benefits

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • MacBook Pro
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Flexible working hours
  • Two fantastic company Away Weeks a year (last one was in Madrid)
  • Convenient Shoreditch office location
  • Regular fun events organised by our Cultural Works Committee
  • Improve coding skills with our Software Development Guild
  • Regular meetups/team offsites

Remote

Description:

RESPONSIBILITIES/QUALIFICATIONS

.NET Developer with experience in C#, .Net Core 2.1, , ASP.Net Core, Azure Graph API, Azure Powershell

Docker & Azure Kubernetes experience in building / configuring and maintaining

Azure DevOps experience utilizing Azure pipelines, Azure Repos, and connecting to Azure Automation

Open API standard development: Will be responsible for building and maintaining a standard API layer,

Azure API Management experience

Azure Application Insights experience is a plus, App Insights will be built into entire code base for central logging.

Basic understanding of the Azure cloud platform and resource creation

Experience with message bus solutions is a plus

Similar with advanced secure software development lifecycles that includes operations (DevSecOps)

Training other developers on new SSDLC process.

Experience with multiple development models (Agile, Scrum, Kanban etc)

Experience with being a scrum master

Development team management

Initiate and lead scripting and automation efforts to automate DevSecOps code deployments.

Responsible for maximizing system uptime and availability, ensuring functional and performance SLAs.

Responsible for establishing end-to-end monitoring and alerting for various systems.

Creation of playbooks to run when responding to alerts or incidents.

Prior experience with CI/CD deployment automation systems.

Working knowledge of Visual Studio, Visual Code, PowerShell, Azure CLI, Azure DevOps/Team Foundation Server.

Work with cloud operations team to resolve frequent trouble tickets through developing scripts in an Azure cloud hosted

environment.

Work well independently without requiring routine supervision.

Prior experience with technology consulting is a plus.

4+ years of experience in a DevOps team with working knowledge of Azure Cloud or Azure Gov Cloud, certifications in Azure is

a plus.

2+ years of experience with software defined networks, application gateways, and load balancing configuration and automation

in Azure.

Functional understanding of supporting and troubleshooting application level systems.

Ability to diagnose communications and performance issue in a multi-tiered cloud architecture.

Working familiarity with compliance control standards such as PCI/DSS, FIPS, or NIST; knowledge of GDPR is a plus.

Demonstrated technical expertise in the following areas:

Windows Server Deployment Automation.

SQL Server 2016 always on deployment and synchronization scripting preferred.

PowerShell, JSON, Python or other scripting languages.

Ability to use MS Office Tools specifically MS Excel, Word, and Visio to make technical documentation.

  • Familiarity with complete suite of AWS Services, with particular in those that are heavily used when providing DevOps Automation solutions, including tools like CloudFormation, EC2, Route53, S3, etc.
  • 2-5+ years of technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef. Puppet or Ansible creating continuous delivery systems
Desired Skills:

  • Advanced skill set in programming in Python, Java or Ruby
  • Expertise in containerization with Docker or Kubernetes
  • Experience building pipeline with CI/CD tools Jenkins
  • AWS Professional Certification

items.title: Linux Cloud Operations Engineer- Direct Hire- Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=6, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=33, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Vaco is looking for a fully remote Linux Cloud Operations Engineer for our client.


The Linux Cloud Operations Engineer is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems, software and related infrastructure. This individual participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. This individual ensures that operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values, enabling customers, staff, and partners.


Responsibilities:



  • Build, maintain, and support production and non-production servers within AWS
  • Lead server-related maintenance such as patching, account maintenance, backups, and security permissions
  • Monitor server security, perform routine security assessments, and manage software update services
  • Daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
  • Triage and resolve Production incidents related to the cloud platform and the applications that run there
  • Participate in root cause analysis and post mortem discussions
  • Build effective monitoring, alerts, and metrics for production services and applications
  • Ensure system scalability, redundancy, and failover mechanisms are working and tested
  • Provide support to Development and QA teams around automation and CI/CD pipeline
  • Provide support for application deployments
  • Assist in testing changes in lower environments to ensure solution is as desired
  • Provide assistance in maintaining compliance with password resets, access reviews, remediation of Operational Incidents and MSIs
  • Develop and document processes to support ongoing development, change control, and production maintenance
  • Provide after-hours support as needed

Job Requirements:



  • 3+ years of experience maintaining complex, secure Java/LAMP systems in AWS
  • 5+ years Linux System Administration experience
  • Experience administering web servers running Apache, Tomcat, IIS, Nginx
  • Solid knowledge of AWS platform and its services - including but not limited to: AMIs, Route53, VPC, EC2, S3, IAM, AWS CLI, EBS, ELB, SQS, CloudWatch, CloudTrail
  • Hands on experience in AWS provisioning of systems, securing of VPC, implementation of Security Groups, Identity and Access Management, Backups, Restore and Disaster Recovery
  • Experience with Docker/Kubernetes and container orchestration
  • Experience deploying Infrastructure as Code using configuration orchestration tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation
  • Experience with CICD pipelines (e.g. Maven / circleCI)
  • Experience with Git, Bitbucket or GitHub
  • Experience with system health and performance monitoring tools (CloudWatch, SolarWinds, Nagios, SumoLogic, Splunk)
  • Networking experience including IPsec, VPN, DNS, certificate management, load balancing, firewalls and routing
  • Some programming / scripting experience (Java, Perl, Ruby, Python, bash)
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related technical field or equivalent experience in a technical position
- provided by Dice

items.title: Marketing Operations Specialist
items.content:
Marketing Operations Specialist at Square 2 Marketing

Remote

Marketing Operations Specialist

This position, reporting to the Chief Operations Officer, will set up, track and report on marketing programs for client companies. The ideal candidate will have experience implementing trigger-based communications, general email campaigns, reporting and data cleansing programs.

Qualified applicants should have proficiency in Marketo (or other similar marketing automation platform, ideally HubSpot) and CRM systems (ideally Salesforce.com).

This is an excellent opportunity for a qualified candidate to directly contribute to the growth of the company while growing a career in marketing.

While our main office is in the Philadelphia area, remote candidates are encouraged to apply for this position.

Core Responsibilities

  • Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and lead management in systems including but not limited to Marketo, Salesforce and HubSpot
  • Provide recommendations that enhance future lead and campaign performance
  • Provide best practices to client engagements that aid in the strengthening of marketing and sales process and performance
  • Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) use to generate, distribute and report on leads
  • Participate in client projects in a distributed environment
  • Set up email campaigns, provide QA and support ongoing testing
  • Document processes and procedures for client marketing efforts and programs
  • Cleanse lists, and raise and fix data issues with client approval
  • Build landing pages and forms using pre-built templates
  • Build marketing reports on campaign performance

Underpinnings Of Success

  • 5-10+ years of experience managing marketing campaigns, creating reports and ensuring data hygiene
  • Experience with marketing automation tools (ideally Marketo, Salesforce.com and HubSpot) in a B2B environment, preferably within an agency, media company or technology organization
  • Must be comfortable working in a distributed team environment and be able to collaborate well with a team of consultants in a remote environment
  • Desire to work on multiple client projects
  • Organized and able to manage project tasks independently, meeting deadlines and objectives for each
  • Great interpersonal, organizational and communication skills

Benefits

  • Work-from-home flexibility
  • Unlimited time off after one year
  • Health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) plan with employer contribution
  • 30-day sabbatical after five years
  • Vacation bonus after five years
  • Maternity and paternity leave
Apply for job

items.title: Site Reliability Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Site Reliability Engineer at Cisco

Remote

LOCATION:

Austin, Texas, US

ADDITIONAL LOCATION(S)

100% remote or any core Cisco offices

AREA OF INTEREST

Engineer Software

JOB TYPE

Professional

TECHNOLOGY INTEREST

AI or Artificial Intelligence, Cloud and Data Center, Collaboration, Video, Software Development, Testing

JOB ID

1262459

Note: Beyond Austin, Texas, hiring for this role is open to 100% remote workers or those that are interested in working out of any of our core Cisco office locations.

Have you ever had a poor customer experience and thought of a million ways in which it could be improved? Have you ever empathized with those whose job it is to deliver customer experience and imagined how, if properly empowered and motivated, the overall service delivery experience could be better? If so, we want to talk.

In the Cisco Customer Journey Solutions R&D group, we are passionate about delivering amazing experiences to both customers and employees. We believe software can truly change the world and how it gives and receives customer service and it is our mission to be the leader in this space. To enable this vision, we are looking for passionate, smart, and motivated Site Reliability Engineers to join our Client Experiences team.

Who are you?

  • A software engineer and/or a scripting-savvy Linux system administrator who hates the monotony and boredom of manual tasks and you love the challenge of taking the most complex manual procedures and automating them.
  • You look at production systems ideally SaaS systems as an interesting and infinite problem domain in which you can apply your craft to deliver an equally infinite value stream of solutions.
  • You could also be an Ops professional that can seek out and anticipate problems before they happen and take action to avoid them. Your scars, PTSD, and your medals of valor will be prized here.
  • A challenge seeking, outcome-hungry problem solver with an insatiable curiosity and entrepreneurial spirit.
  • A customer-obsessed advocate for quality and reliability. You smile when thinking of ways you have made a customers (and/or colleagues) life easier.
  • You have read about (or are willing to read) and deeply understand Googles SRE work. However, founding a religious order on the subject, albeit impressive, is not required.
  • A loyal team player that strives to win and win together, leaving no one behind.
  • A coach, mentor, trainer, perpetual student, and all-around good person that colleagues love and respect.

Some skills wed like you to have

NOTE: We are looking for all levels of expertise and are willing to train you beyond whatever level you are at in any of these areas.

  • Programming/scripting in one or many languages. We use Bash, Python, Java, and some Golang but were always looking for new and improved options.
  • Linux operating system administration. We are looking for all levels of expertise and are willing to train you beyond a foundational ability.
  • Cloud computing in one or many public cloud providers. We strive to be cloud provider agnostic but we love folks that know Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud (GCP), and/or Microsoft Azure.
  • Instrumentation, Telemetry, and Monitoring best practices and tools. Theres a lot of ways to do this what have you had success with?
  • Build, test, and deployment tools and best practices. Not all our SRE positions require this but having some experience here will be an advantage.
  • Chaos engineering principles, practices, and tools. Yes, we are willing to test in production are you up for the challenge of wreaking chaos while ensuring system reliability?
  • Project management. Were not looking for PMP certification but having a baseline understanding of how successful projects are delivered (e.g. planning, communication, risk management) is appreciated. We are evolving in our Agile and Lean processes so experience in these methods is a strong advantage.
  • Strong verbal and written communication. We value honesty and directness while maintaining a safe and trusting professional environment.
Apply for job

If you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer with experience, please read on!

We're located in sunny Southern California however we're looking for an experienced DevOps candidate to join our team - we allow 100% remote!! We're a technology/health company that is bridging the gap with user data to determine health behavior and needs. We received our Series C funding and we're ready to ramp up our team and product.

We offer great benefits including health, dental, and vision for your and your dependents; we also offer a relaxed and flexible work environment to accommodate any of the hiccups that life throws your way. Applications are reviewed and processed quickly - please apply today if you are interested.

**Application will be considered incomplete unless screening questions are answered; incomplete applications cannot be submitted for further review. Please answer all screening questions in detail in order to expedite the process.**

What You Will Be Doing

- Solving complex technical problems
- Working on product architecture and scalability of distributed systems
- Architect, develop & deploy the operation of our systems
- Ensure proper health and security of our systems & data
- Some on-call experience, distributed among the DevOps team
- Creating scalable pipelines for cost-effectiveness and security

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience and the following:

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar area of study
- Strong experience working in a Linux environment
- Previous experience in a DevOps culture
- Use of configuration management & automation tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible)
- Working in the cloud (AWS is a big plus!)
- RDBMS experience (Postgres, MySQL)
- Messaging/queing systems (RabbitMQ, SQS, Kinesis)

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Team events
- Lunches
- 100% RemoteSo, if you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer (100% Remote) with experience, please apply today!

items.content:
iTech Solutions

Devops Architecture Engineering 100


DevOps Architecture & Engineering
100% Remote (East Coast Hours)

People want to be treated like individuals. Our client gets that!!!

That's why they embrace and encourage peoples' uniqueness, helping to give them the strength and confidence to show the world who they really are. The coverage, expertise and services we provide are at the very core of how we help people achieve their full potential and ultimately, improve their health, well-being and sense of security.
Before they can accomplish any of that, we have to have the right people in place.
The Delivery Acceleration Solutions Group's goal is to help the organization to rapidly produce software products and services while thinking about quality throughout the SDLC. This is the essence of DevOps. Are you an individual who understands the DevOps mentality? Do you have a start-up attitude, but think like an enterprise? Like taking risks and love it when it pays off? The healthcare industry is evolving and time to market is critical to success. Our Client is changing and as our CIO has said: "We are not moving fast enough. We need an individual who thinks differently and has the experience to influence an organization.
----------
Major Responsibilities:


* Collaborate with team members (including scrum masters, product owners, system architecture ) to implement solutions supporting the DevOps evolution.

* Extend our existing CI/CD best practices to our public cloud platforms to create a reusable pipeline for those workloads

* Create additional supporting solutions using languages like Python, Node, Groovy or Go.

* Ensure that everything we run (products or in-house developed solutions) are deployed using the same deployment automation (CI/CD) pipelines we build for our enterprise counterparts (Jenkins CI, Gitlab CI, Sonarqube, Artifactory, etc.)

* Create an observability architecture for our solutions in order to make them easier to support while they run (log aggregation, monitoring, alerting, etc.)

* Collaborate with Enterprise Architecture, Engineering Architecture and other architecture leaders to curate and manage best-of-breed solutions to support a DevOps culture

* Maintain alignment with the industry as new architectures and capabilities within products we currently manage emerge and employ them in a way that improves our solutions

* Engage with the technical community to collaboratively develop technologies through an inner-source methodology to fuel capability reuse




Other Attributes:


* Has strong focus on business outcomes and is focused on results

* Subject matter expert in one or more technologies/platforms or highly specialized area(s), and working knowledge of other related domains

* Is comfortable with open source and understand when a good commercial compliment is available

* Bachelors degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, at least eight, typically ten or more years of solid, diverse work experience in IT with a minimum of four years experience application program development, or the equivalent in education and work experience.




Technologies:


* Terraform

* AWS

* Jenkins/Groovy

* Ansible

* Openshift/Kubernetes

* Splunk/Prometheus/Grafana/Alertmanager

items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
DevOps / Sysadmin
Skills:
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • DevOps
  • Java
  • Jenkins
  • Unix

    • Intro

    Raisin is a dynamic, successful, and quickly growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit.

    Raisin is looking for an intelligent, hard working, and highly motivated software engineer with a focus in infrastructure and operations to help us navigate this process of technical, social, and process evolution.

    Your Responsibilities

    • Infrastructure automation and validation
    • Creation of both tooling and policy around our growing production and development environments
    • Provide support and mentoring to both developers and junior team members
    • Helping engineers to wire together their applications and our infrastructure.

    Main requirements

    •  University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related fields or equivalent industry experience.
    • A strong background in distributed systems infrastructure.
    • We want a grounding in principles. We primarily use AWS, but we don't particularly care what service you've used before.
    • Experience with borg a plus.
    • Experience building secure and reliable environments while maintaining simplicity.
    • Experience with both infrastructure and image level tooling such as Chef, Puppet, Packer, Cloud Formation or Terraform.
    • Experience with container management and orchestrations systems such as Kubernetes, ECS, or even Mesos:.
    • Enjoys crossing boundaries between groups and technologies, and willing to engage in challenging code and architectural discussions.
    • Experience leading larger projects is a plus.


    Nice to have

    • Good German skills are a plus
    • Hands on experience with any of the following systems, technologies and tools; AWS, Kubernetes,  Jenkins, Docker, Packer, Infrastructure as Code, Java, Python, Go

    Perks

    Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. 

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %

  • Ability to work with other developers and inter-disciplinary teams collaboratively and professionally.

  • Research new configuration tools and methodologies.
  • Research new software development tools and methodologies, evaluating opportunities for efficiency or quality gains.
About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. The Role
As a DevOps engineer, you will be heavily involved in projects throughout their entire development life-cycle. The environment is fast paced so confidence in your own coding ability, product knowledge and decision making skills will be essential in order to make sure you can keep up with the rest of the team.
Successful candidates will have great interpersonal skills. Many of our projects rely heavily on the cohesiveness of different teams working together so poorly communicated decisions will result in a negative impact on everyone.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=16, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Site Reliability Engineer or DevOps Engineer at Ephesoft

Remote

3150 Engineering HQ Irvine, California

JOB DESCRIPTION

Builders and Fixers Wanted!

Ready to invent the future? Ephesoft is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to help transform how develop, deliver, and support our products. You will work with a team of engineers in an agile & fast-paced business environment. The ideal candidate will have strong technical skills complemented by an aptitude for coaching and mentoring teammates as we strive to adopt a devops culture and embrace continuous delivery.

If you are right for this role, you will:

  • Help deliver on the availability and performance of Ephesofts hosted products.
  • Participate in a world class team focused on continuously delivering quality and value to our clients
  • Help mentor other in proper devops practices
  • Responsible for providing 247 coverage for all mission-critical services and even willing to be on-call at any time as needed
  • Anticipate the future. Have an almost innate ability to Embrace the unknowns between existing technologies and future solutions. Jedi mind tricks are a plus.
  • Dive in deep with cloud providers. (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Take on other duties as assigned. (Yeah, the day-to-day stuff happens here, too.)
  • Participate in an on-call rotation. (Part of that continuous availability stuff.)

Qualifications

  • At least 3 years experience designing, implementing and supporting multivendor cloud-based infrastructure and platform services including AWS and Azure required
  • Significant experience successfully implementing CI/CD using modern technologies with hand-on experience using tools like Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins, SonarQube, Docker, AWS Cloud Formation
  • Configuration management using Power Shell, Ruby, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, or similar
  • Experience with disaster recovery, fault tolerance and high availability
  • Experience in open source technologies like, Docker, Git, SpringIO, Tomcat
  • Containerization strategy and technology experience required
  • Experience with products built using serverless technology like AWS Lambda or Azure Functions
  • Broad knowledge in systems monitoring, alerting and analytics including using tools such as DataDog, Splunk, New Relic, AWS CloudTrail, etc.
  • Experience with technologies such as MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Redis, ElasticSearch highly desired.
  • In-depth network and system engineering experiences including DNS, ADFS, HTTPS, Firewalls, L7 routing, etc
  • Must be able to act as a champion for a DevOps culture
  • Understanding of cloud security best practices and working knowledge of: encryption, certificates, hashing and compliance (SOC, PCI, HITRUST, ISO)

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Ephesoft is a global, fast-growing, profitable, private company looking to add great people to our team. After our recent (first-round of) funding, we are seeking urgently to fill positions worldwide. Our industry-leading advanced capture solution classifies and extracts data from structured and unstructured documents faster and more accurately than any other technology not only to improve business processes and efficiency, but also uncovers dark data lurking in company intranets and file stores.

Ephesoft has been named to the Inc. 500 list of fastest growing privately-held companies in the US, and named one of the top companies to work for in Orange County. The company offers benefits, 401K and other perks. Ephesoft is headquartered in Irvine, California with offices in London, Frankfurt, Germany, Australia and India. Come build the future with us!

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Ephesoft is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

This role is primarily based in Irvine, California. Otherwise qualified applicants may be considered for relocation or remote working. Candidates outside of the United States will not be considered.

Apply for job

items.content:
Remote Storage Engineer / Systems Administrator - 3rd Shift

I don t think the physical location of the resource is critical, including India, as long as they can be had at a low rate and work US night hours.

Most of the activities will be scheduled within our change windows from midnight to 6 am. A rough estimate of the off hour support needed is 30 - 50 hours per week, including some Saturday and Sunday Work

Storage Engineers have been spending considerable time working on maintenance activities outside of their regular work hours. We are looking to relieve them by offloading some of the maintenance tasks to a subcontractor engineers.Listed below are some of the tasks that we are looking to handover:

  • De-provisioning
  • Provisioning
  • New LUNs ( Logical Unit Numbers )
  • LUN expansions
  • Expedited tickets
  • Incident tickets
  • Drive failures
  • Module failures
  • Hardware replacements Co-ordinate with Vendor
  • Modules (XIV, Flash)
  • Drives
  • Battery replacements
  • 3PAR upgrades Coordinate with HP
  • Switch port enable/disable
  • Cleanup
  • Host definitions
  • Volumes
  • Zones
  • Off-hours on-call support
  • Documented tasks for projects.
  • Examples: Monitoring scripts, Monitoring ports after critical changes


Project related tasks such as NPIV implementation will continue to be handled by the End Client engineers.

They ve clarified the request to be 30-50 hrs per *week* of support with at least 1-2 resources.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Cloud Engineer - Fully Remote - $150-160/hr. - 12 months

Cloud Engineer - Fully Remote - $150-160/hr. - 12 months

The client is seeking a motivated Cloud Engineer. The client is a leading digital technology services company. Serving as a technology and cloud implementation expert, the Engineer will be responsible for the design development, and operational support Cloud solutions and services. The engineer is also responsible for defining and implementing engineering processes and standards and for leading the integration of these processes with other related business and IT processes. The role will be contracted for 12 months with the possibility of extending for another year.

Responsibilities:
  • Build out and implement the roadmap for Cloud Architecture and Services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, ITaaS, etc)
  • Aligns IT architecture and Cloud solutions with the project's business goals and objectives
  • Lead and execute the design and modeling of tactical architectures for delivery, development, and support of projects
  • Participate in the service and solutions development life cycle to ensure sound Cloud solutions are implemented and transitioned to Operations
  • Participate in planning, implementation, and growth of our Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure foundational platform.
  • Conduct proof of concept (POC) and implement the design in AWS / Azure.
  • Development of automated solutions to monitor and support our software development and release processes.
Required skills:
  • Experience using cloud based technologies (AWS - EC2 / S3, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Strong Cloud and Technical skills
  • Experience designing, developing, deploying, testing Cloud architecture/services.
  • Experience with programming and infrastructure automation (e.g. Python, Shell, Java, and JSON).
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to establish, implement, and enforce appropriate Cloud IT standards to meet business requirements
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills
If you're interested in becoming a Cloud Engineer for a leading digital technology services company, from the comfort of your home, then I welcome you to send your resume to Tim Welles at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

items.content:
Ready to expand your knowledge and contribute to new ideas pertaining to engineering autonomy? If you have experience in software development and systems operations with AWS DevOps, this could be the job for you. Our qualified employees work to help enterprises develop fundamentally secure services for faster and more consistent software and infrastructure deployments. We are exclusive to AWS and are excited to increase product functionality.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
We work to provide our customers with the flexibility to be in charge of their own software. By employing industry leading continuous delivery patterns and collaboratively working with other members to execute them, we help our clients to achieve successful solutions. We also collaboratively work with Senior DevOps Automation Engineers to assist and empower customers to come up with self-service solutions and create better outcomes

BENEFITS
We understand the importance of a work-life balance, which is why we allow our employees to work anywhere with available internet connection. Outside of any core working hours, you could be working from home, the beach, outer space or a coworking space. We value your career goals, as well as our customer's goals, and are happy to allow employees an unlimited amount of PTO. Employees are part of a large distributed remote team. In order to insure you'll never feel alone, we provide employees the tools to stay in touch and collaborate with colleagues, whether that's through simple meetings or a pair programming exercise.
  • Work from home
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Flexible schedule
  • Continuous learning opportunities
  • Part of a large distributed remote team
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
  • 4+ years of technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • Demonstrated programming capability in programming languages such as Ruby, Python, Java, C#, etc.
  • Successful customer engagements providing continuous delivery solutions, preferably employing AWS
  • Demonstrated Linux or Windows command-line capability
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS Services related to DevOps, with particular depth in CloudFormation, OpsWorks and IAM
  • Experience establishing and employing Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Jenkins or other CI tools
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef (or other such tools) in creating continuous delivery systems
  • Preferred AWS Certified Associate (Solutions Architect, Sys Ops, Developer).
AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=43, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Site Reliability Engineer - 100% Remote

***Candidates must be US Citizens or Permanent Residents. Our client cannot transfer/sponsor for any type of visa at this time and you must join them full-time.***

This position will report to our Director of Technical Operations. Although it will require you to participate in an on-call rotation on nights and weekends, work/life balance is important to us and we empower our employees to identify and resolve issues before they lead to incidents and alerts. We are looking for candidates who are skilled in both managing their everyday tasks and improving their environment.

As a Site Reliability Engineer, a typical day may include the following:

  • Monitoring and maintaining the Development, Testing/QA, Staging and Production environments
  • Mitigating production performance issues effectively by taking responsibility for seeing those performance issues through resolution with the goal of automating to prevent problem recurrence
  • Scheduling, testing and maintaining application deployments and pipelines
  • Working with engineering to perform capacity planning, analysis, implementation and testing of the platform
  • Working closely with team members and development to improve existing systems
  • Assisting and working with the DBA to increase reliability and automation
  • Participating in on-call/on-demand network, server and database support

This job may be right for you if you have:

  • 5+ years of experience administering a consumer-facing Microsoft Web Platform (IIS, ASP.NET/.NET Core, MSSQL)
  • 3+ years of experience setting up and administering high availability solutions in Windows Servers
  • 5+ years of experience administering and maintaining MSSQL and Active Directory
  • Demonstrable knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, web application security and distributed applications
  • Experience, skills and knowledge of MSSQL environments
  • Experience with mixed Infrastructure, Virtual and Cloud-based server environments
  • Experience with load balancing and multi-layer application stacks
  • Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools and software management tools for 24x7 environments
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills required to work in our culture-driven team environment

You re extra awesome if you have:

  • Interest and experience within the hobby gaming industry
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies
  • Familiarity with IaaS and PaaS solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS)
  • Familiarity with Elasticsearch
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Demonstrated proficiency in writing build scripts to automate tasks that can be automated
  • Knowledge of common systems/development tools
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible
  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design and problem solving
- provided by Dice

Remote, anywhere in the US - Must be a US citizen

Travel Max 25%

$110,000 - $155,000 Base + Benefits


This is an exciting opportunity for an AWS DevOps Engineer / Senior DevOps Engineer to work for a leading AWS Partner on a remote basis. This particular role offers a vast amount or training, chance to go to Re:Invent, Unlimited PTO, put through AWS Certs, regular pay-reviews and an excellent benefits package. It also offers working with some of the leading technologies and Fortune 500 companies. This is an opportunity not to be missed.

As an AWS DevOps Engineer / Senior DevOps Engineer you will ideally have come from a full stack background and have a passion for code and the cloud.

  • Worked on multiple development, operations or full-stack implementations for the last couple of years
  • Have solid experience in various programming languages Ruby, Python, Java, C# etc
  • Worked on successful customer engagements providing Continuous Delivery (CD)
  • Experience employing Continuous Integration (CI) practices and tools
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS services
  • Have an AWS cert or a willing to undertake in your first few months



As an AWS DevOps Engineer / Senior DevOps Engineer you will be:-

-Employing industry leading Continuous Delivery patterns and solutions
-Working collaboratively with other Automation Engineers to deliver solutions
-Providing all the technical capabilities, but also sharing large concepts to customers and other engineers.
-Have a passion to keep up to date with changing technologies
-Be willing to keep up to date with the latest AWS certifications
-Happy to mentor more junior members of the team.

This is an exciting opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to work more with AWS / or an AWS DevOps Engineer to continue their passion with a leading AWS partner! This company is really forward thinking and offers great benefits, they really are a complete CLOUD company.

All applicants must be a US citizen due to the customers they will be working on, they must be able to undergo background checks.

This is a remote role across the US, we cannot work with third party suppliers on this occasion.

Apply now for this exciting AWS DevOps Engineer / Senior DevOps Engineer opportunity!

items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ) that is seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer.

Summary:
The Senior DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, and documentation of systems, automation and configuration to support an environment that hosts customer and development operations in public cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS. They will provide technical & hands-on leadership to create an Operations environment that supports enterprise SaaS systems deployed across many clients of around 1,000,000 end users. This person will work with the Application Hosting partners, Operations, Product Development, & Support teams.

The environment will include system and application components that support line of business functionality, metrics collection, alerting of critical and non-critical events, dashboards for technical and business review, and other telemetry/instrumentation required to meet or exceed customer SLA's. The environment will be developed using industry standard development techniques, built with industry standard technologies including Java and Microsoft .NET. The candidate will have the ability to work from 3-5 days a week from home.

REQUIREMENTS:
* Ideally has 5+ years or more of DevOps experience
* Strong CI/CD experience required
* Candidate must have strong leadership, communication and technical skills as well as the ability to work well in a team environment
* The ability to handle aggressive timelines and focus under pressure is a must
* Experience in the design, development, and documentation of systems, automation and configuration to support an environment that hosts customer and development operations in public cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure and/or Amazon AWS
* Must be familiar with Automation
* Familiarity with .NET and/or Java - the candidate does not have to be an expert at both but does have to be willing to utilize both stacks based on the project
* Local candidates only

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

- provided by Dice

DevOps Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Gaming, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1150 people
Company type: Private
Company: BlueLabs Software | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours

Technologies

distributed-system
amazon-web-services
google-cloud-platform
terraform
kubernetes
sysadmin
is-serp 86 1 9
pietro909 Engineering Lead - Client Team at BlueLabs 1.4k 15 25
Laurynas Tretjakovas 576 2 11
Enrique Fernndez Casado 1 1

Job description

A few months ago we started out with the vision of building a next generation sports betting platform focused on performance, reliability, modularity and automation. We believe that our experience paired with todays technologies, great talent and the agility of a startup environment will enable us to deliver a best-in-class product that meets the demands of the market of tomorrow. 

We are now on the lookout for a DevOps Engineer who wants to join our distributed team and help us execute our vision. 

As DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for ensuring that our different engineering teams have their needs covered when it comes to cross-cutting concerns such as Infrastructure, Security, Instrumentation and CI/CD Pipelines.

Your deliverables will have a direct impact on the day-to-day work of all our engineers. You will help them reduce the time to market of the tasks and features they are working on. Whilst development and operational efficiency will be your primary goal, you should also have an eye for performant and resilient infrastructures.

Your responsibilities as DevOps Engineer at BlueLabs will include:

  • Enable the different teams to deliver and operate their services on their own

  • Be a strong advocate for keeping all things automated and under version control

  • Provide DevOps and SRE expertise and best practices to all developers within the organisation

  • Work hand in hand with the Engineering Leads to execute the company's strategy and assist the development teams when it comes to topics such as Infrastructure, Security, Instrumentation and CI/CD pipelines

  • Be the first point of contact when it comes to cross-cutting concerns, while ensuring that you do not become a single point of failure

BlueLabs Sports Betting platform consists of tens of microservices written in Elixir, Go and Scala. You are not required to have professional experience with either of these languages but being interested in them will be valued positively, since it will help you better understand the needs of our Engineering teams.

Remote Work

We are hiring for talent, not for a specific location. You will find that members of our team are distributed all over Europe. Being a distributed team enables us to hire only the best, without being restricted to the talent pool available at a specific geographic location. However, to facilitate team communication and collaboration we currently require you to be located in a European time zone (between UTC-1 and UTC+3). You must also be able to travel to other European locations a few times a year for on-site meetings and workshops.

Compensation

The budgeted compensation range for this role is 65k-90k annually, depending on your background and experience. As an independent contractor you will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees in your country of residence (unless you are based in Malta, in which case you will be employed). In addition to that, we offer a number of perks to each of our team members as we truly believe in a healthy work-life balance and continuous learning.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience working as a DevOps (or Systems) Engineer
  • Professional experience with GCP and/or AWS
  • Deep understanding of cloud technologies (e.g. GCP), container orchestration platforms (e.g. Kubernetes), infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform), code instrumentation (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk) and CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Jenkins)
  • Interest in distributed systems
  • Interest in microservice architecture, data- and message-based technologies (e.g. RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka)
  • Interest in keeping yourself up to date and learning new languages, frameworks and technologies as required
  • Product-oriented mindset and eagerness to take part in shaping the products we build
  • Ability to work autonomously in a fully distributed team
  • Good communication skills in verbal and written English
Apply now

Benefits

  • Distributed Team, enabling us to hire Europe's best talents
  • Work only with the latest technologies
  • Use the best tools and resources money can buy
  • Regular onsite meetings across Europe
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Personal Development Allowance of 1,000 annually
  • Co-Working Space & Home Office Allowances
  • Flexible working hours and time-off policy
  • Monthly wellbeing allowance for Gym Membership, Massages etc.

Job Description:
Role: Software Systems Engineer - Linux
Duration: 15 months
Work location:
Dallas, TX - 75244
Houston, Texas- 77236
we prefer someone who is local to Texas, as this is 2 days onsite(Tuesday/Thursday) and 3 days REMOTE
Senior Software Systems Engineer - Linux/Unix
Vulnerability remediation and management a must
As a Systems Engineer your objective is to maintain the security compliance standards for Unix / Linux derivative operating systems servers for all Enterprise Cloud (eCloud) instances. You will define, test, and document security remediation scripts and SOPs. Additionally, your role will include supporting eCloud implementations by documenting unique configuration parameters for new builds and capacity expansions. This will involve interfacing with management software to allocate IPs, select hostnames based on standards, document the deployment using Visio, and completing build manifests that enable the deployments.
Track open security vulnerabilities
Test vulnerability remediation SOPs
Develop remediation scripts to automate as much as possible
Schedule change requests
Execute change requests
Evaluate, test, and define configuration item stack for all hardware and software components within the architecture specific to Unix/Linux derivative operating system servers.
Maintain architecture documentation using MS Visio or like software
Responsibilities include:
Ongoing maintenance & administration of assigned systems.
Adherence to policies, processes and procedures within your areas of responsibility.
Assistance with execution of projects related to areas of responsibility.
Developing, configuring and maintaining Cloud Computing architecture and related systems.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Configuration Management Suites like Salt, Puppet or Ansible
Git or other Source Control (SVN, CVS, Accurev, etc.) and GitHub
Programming - Work with multiple emerging programming languages (Ruby, Python, Perl, etc.)
Scripting . Bash, PowerShell, etc.
Develop, document, test, and use REST APIs
CI/CD Jenkins, etc.
Code review and writing tests should be second nature (Test Driven Development)
5 plus years of experience of coding
MUST BE a self-starter, capable of working independently and in teams with minimum supervision
DevOps or Agile Development
5+ years of broad-based IT experience with technical knowledge of network, hardware, storage, operating systems and applications.
7+ years of experience supporting Unix/Linux derivative operating system servers and systems administration preferably in cloud environment.
Industry-related certifications (RHCE or similar) a plus.
Unix / Linux / RHEL or similar administration
Proficient in Python/Bash/Perl/other scripting language

Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

Job description

What you'll do1. You'll design, build, and maintain the tools our software engineers use daily to develop, test, and deploy services.2. You'll work to improve the performance, reliability, and security of the Sticker Mule cloud infrastructure.3. You'll collaborate with other engineering teams and stakeholders to ensure we're always building the right solution.4. You'll share your expertise with other members of the team, review your peers' code, and mentor other engineers.5. You'll participate in periodic on-call duties.About you1. You have been a professional software engineer for 3+ years.2. You're highly skilled in two or more general-purpose languages, and one of those languages is Go.3. You have Linux roots, you contain with Docker, you schedule with Kubernetes.4. You have automated complex tasks with Bash.5. You have practical experience with more than one cloud provider, AWS and Google Cloud would be especially beneficial.6. You used logging, monitoring and distributed tracing systems.7. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.Why you should joinWe believe high performing organizations include people from different backgrounds and experiences. We are committed to building a safe, supportive work environment where team members can bring their diverse perspectives.In joining the Sticker Mule team, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact as part of a small, highly motivated team. We have a large variety of interesting technical problems, and we offer above-market compensation. We strive to provide a sensible balance between work and non-work, and we allow you to define your own schedule.How the process works1. Youll send us your application including samples of your code and writing. Alternatively, if you dont have any samples or cant provide them, you can do a take-home test.Selected candidates will be invited to begin our interview process:2. An introductory interview3. A technical discussion with other engineers, where we'll go through your technical background and the samples you provided. We might also ask you a few technical questions.4. A final meeting with our VP of HR.Compensation and benefits1. $90,000-$115,000+ depending on experience.2. Signing bonus.3. 4 weeks vacation. 
Apply now

About Sticker Mule

Sticker Mule is looking for Site Reliability Engineers to help improve the reliability and performance of our cloud infrastructure. In this role, you'll also build and maintain the tools our engineers use to deploy our services dozens of times a day. Your work will meaningfully impact the experience of our customers and the happiness of our engineering teams.Who we areSticker Mule is the Internet's fastest-growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable, and powered by an outstanding, globally distributed team who cares deeply about delivering a great customer experience at the highest technical standards. Our software engineering team operates from 20 different countries, and we're always looking for more exceptional engineers to join us.See more about our teams here

items.content:
SOCi

Dev Ops Engineer


About SOCi
SOCi is the leading enterprise solution for social content discovery and social media marketing. Our next-generation, all-in-one social media SaaS platform utilizes a proprietary scoring algorithm to discover, evaluate, and rank social content, changing how enterprises, franchises, and affiliates market on social media to their target audiences. SOCi has a growing team of passionate, innovative, and fun people in both our San Diego, CA and Austin, TX offices.
*This position is open to fully remote candidates
The job
* Rocking an EC2 Cloud infrastructure with lots of moving parts that require constant updating and maintenance.
* Working closely with our marvelous engineering department and focusing on packaging and deploying our software to the aforementioned infrastructure.
* You will be helping to streamline our processes, creating, researching, and maintaining our release management tools, as well as helping us resolve and troubleshoot issues in our development, test, and production environments.
* You will be working with a fun, enthusiastic and team of professionals who will be happy to get you acquainted with our software and jump into new challenges with you! 
* Other tasks and duties as required


You
* Experience in managing CloudFormation templates along with different AWS services such as RDS come as a big advantage.
* Familiarity with Ansible and working with POSIX systems is also a plus.
* Working with git should be second nature to you.
* You will be working closely to engineering, so a background in software development is necessary.
* While the job does not directly involve engineering efforts, being able to understand the connections within the software for building releases comes as a huge bonus.
* SQL experience (MySQL is a bonus).
* Experienced in release management.
* Unix-based systems.
* Software development (PHP / JS is a bonus).


Why you'll love it here
* Competitive salary!
* Flexible PTO and paid holidays!
* Work directly with SOCi executives and advisors.
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits.
* Opportunity to make a difference and implement your ideas.
* Everyone is held to the highest standards, but we make sure to have fun, too!
* We have amazing customers (UPS, SportClips, Internet Brands, etc) who love our platform. Check us out on G2Crowd, Capterra or TrustPilot.


What's SOCi's culture like?
Our primary driver is professional growth and learning, coupled with a desire to help our customer succeed. We focus heavily on individual mentorship and guidance, peer feedback and are always pushing ourselves and each other to the next level. We're huge on collaboration - mobing/swarming to solve problems either as individual engineering teams, or even Product/Engineering/Design leaders mobing to work out the best new product approach. We focus on moving fast, learning fast, and not looking back.
SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

-Working close with the developers
-Manage All Environments
-Monitor running instances - ensure costs are managed and optimized against performance
-Configuration changes / documentation / automation of changes
-Monitor / manage logs
-Patch management
-Security and key management
-Establish and monitor operational dashboards and work queues
-Monitor infrastructure / application performance & health
-Shared software release duties
-Developing and monitoring infrastructure automation for deployment
-Code coverage metrics
-Monitor build / deployment status
Required experience:
-Be passionate about being challenged and hungry to continuously learn
-Mid-level to Senior on typical operations front (operating system patching, systematic troubleshooting, eye for operational details)
-Must have experience and be extremely comfortable with Unix/Linux server environments
-Comfortable with command line tools Bash, Powershell etc.
-Working understanding of code and script development e.g. Python.
-Familiar with agile software development lifecycles
-Knowledge of best practices and IT operations for always-up, always-available services
-Docker / container cluster management (AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Vagrant, OpenShift, Apache Mesos, Deis, Mesophere DCOS).
-Docker / Microservice release orchestration including Blue Green Deployments and Canary Releases
-Managing infrastructure on Amazon AWS
-Managing infrastructure on Microsoft Azure
-Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery software release management and automation
-Infrastructure as Code - i.e., Terraform and Cloud Formation
-MS SQL and/or MySQL administration / optimization
-NoSQL and caching tools such as MemCache / Redis
-GIT / Source Control tools (i.e., GitHub, Bit Bucket, TFS)

items.content:
BASIC FUNCTION (Primary Purpose):

Work closely with Software Engineers to help them deploy and operate different systems. Help to automate and streamline the company's operations and processes.

Scope (brief description):

We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic DevOps Engineer. As our new DevOps Engineer, you will be in charge of the specification and documentation of the new project features. In addition, you will be developing new features and writing scripts for automation using Perl/Python/Groovy/Java/Bash.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

*Manage the methods of deployment (development, testing and production) and the processes and tools required to execute those deployments.
*Manage the continuous integration systems used to build digital products.
*Manage the software development tools used by the development team and ensure they are scalable and failure proof.
*Create failure management processes and tools so outages can be handled without causing a loss of delivery.
*Champion changes to tools and processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the development team.
*Manage issue tracking and agile development tools (Atlassian JIRA).
*Automate parts of the development delivery process using scripts and other appropriate tools.
*Document processes and user guides for integrated tools and scripts.
*Devise and develop analytical methods and tools to measure the efficiency of products and processes.
*Advise on new technologies and methodologies by becoming an expert in emerging technologies and tools.

The Individual:

Qualifications and Educational requirement(s):

*Educated to degree standard in Computer Science or (or similar engineering discipline) equivalent.
*Should have experience operating in virtual environments.
*Should have experience with both Windows and Unix based operating systems
*Must have a good knowledge of deployment and configuration technologies (e.g. gitlab, CI, ansible tower and terraform).
*Must have a good working knowledge of source control technologies (e.g.Git, subversion).
*Must have a good working knowledge of one or more scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby)
*A sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success
*Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
*Team player
*Good time-management skills
*Interpersonal and communication skills
*At least 3 years of professional experience

About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
